;This is a rocket fired towards Israel taken in the Gaza Strip on October 7. ;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;If it were not for the sudden sound of gunfire, October 7, 2023 would have been a pleasant day Saturday.

;

;In Tel Aviv, Beijing tourist Liu Zihui will usher in the last day of her National Day trip. According to the plan, she was going to visit the Jewish Museum of Tel Aviv University and then go to the ancient city of Jaffa. In Rehovot, Chinese chef Zhang Feng is getting ready for work. This is the busiest time of the week for Chinese restaurant business. Many Israelis choose this day to go out to eat and relax.

;

;In an area near the Gaza Strip, 27-year-old female music fan Millet Ben Haim and her friends were partying all night at a music festival. At this moment, she and her friends were looking forward to for several months.

;

;At the same time, the young Israeli scholar Haim Ketzman stayed at his home in Holit, which is only 1.5 kilometers away from the Gaza Strip, as usual.

;

;A sudden attack suddenly changed the course of their lives.

;

;Some of them witnessed the white tracks of rockets streaking across the sky, some heard gunshots from all directions in the wilderness, and some encountered Hamas armed forces head-on.

;

;;"Crisis, from South to North";

;

;In the early morning of October 7, young music fans sang and danced at the "Parallel Universe" Music Festival In full swing. This music festival originated in Brazil and has a history of 23 years.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters saw from the timetable announced by the organizer that the music festival will start at 23:00 on October 6th and continue until the afternoon of the 7th. This means fans can head out for an "all-night dance party."

;

;Music fans are looking forward to this long-awaited music festival, and Milit is one of them.

;

;The music festival is held near Rem Kibbutz, which is about 1.25 hours' drive from Tel Aviv, Israel's largest city. Many music fans drive here. At the same time, it was only a few kilometers away from the Gaza Strip, which foreshadowed the subsequent tragedy.

;

;At dawn, danger begins to fall.

;

;In the early morning of October 7, Hamas fired thousands of rockets at Israel, and many armed personnel used homemade simple gliders to infiltrate into the disputed area from the Gaza Strip isolation area. Videos and pictures that appeared on social media showed that Hamas militants also entered Israeli-controlled areas in pickup trucks and motorcycles. Those along the Palestinian-Israeli separation zone bear the brunt.

;

;"Around 6:31 in the morning, the music stopped and the siren sounded." Millit recorded the moment with a video on social media. "More and more rockets were flying into the sky and we realized we had to leave immediately," she wrote.

;

;A video circulating on social media showed dozens of young people running in panic in an open field, surrounded by abandoned cars and followed by intensive gunfire.

;

;Along the flight route of the rockets, air defense sirens continued to sound in many places in Israel.

;

;In the central city of Rehovot, Chinese chef Zhang Feng was also woken up by a "sound" at around 6 a.m.

;

;This is between the Gaza Strip and Tel Aviv. Zhang Feng saw "wave after wave" of rockets passing over the city and heading north, "many of which were intercepted."

;

;After the attack began, Zhang Feng and his colleagues squeezed into the small bomb shelter again and again, listening to the sound of air defense sirens, flying artillery shells, and explosions after being intercepted. The first wave of attacks lasted for two or three hours. After more than two years in Israel, Zhang Feng felt that "this was the most powerful one."

;

;Zhang Feng works in a restaurant in Rehovot. On the morning of the 7th, he and his colleagues received a holiday notice, which surprised them. According to him, every Saturday, many Israelis take their families out to eat, which is often the busiest time for restaurant business. Although they have experienced air raid warnings many times before, they will still go to work normally after the danger is lifted.

;

;“We rarely had holidays in the past. The fact that we can have a holiday this time shows that the situation is very serious.” Zhang Feng said.

;

;In the northern city of Jerusalem, Liu Zihui and her companions set off from the hotel by car at around 9 o'clock. Taking advantage of the National Day holiday, she embarked on an "in-depth cultural tour". According to the original plan, they would arrive in Tel Aviv on the morning of the 7th, stay one night and then return home.

;

;However, not long after setting off from Jerusalem, Liu Zihui and his party heard an air raid siren.

;

;"The driver stopped immediately and the tour guide took us to hide in the concert hall on the roadside." Liu Zihui heard from the staff of the concert hall that they also received a short notice to cancel the performance. After the alarm was lifted, the staff also made a special trip to apologize, saying "I'm sorry for causing you such a bad experience during your trip."

;

;For safety reasons, the originally planned trip was canceled and the tour guide took everyone directly to the hotel. Because the reserved room was not ready yet, the group of people waited in the hotel lobby, and lunch was ordered and delivered from a nearby Chinese restaurant. Liu Zihui's room is on the 10th floor, and "helicopters flying over" can be seen directly outside the window.

;

;From 7 p.m., air raid sirens sounded several more times in Tel Aviv. Liu Zihui said that everyone had to eat dinner in the hotel's safe room. It didn't become calm until after 9 p.m. "My companions and I slept in the same clothes, and we didn't dare to take a shower or pack our things until three o'clock in the morning."

;

;;Evacuation, crowds flocked to the airport;

;

;When the crisis occurred, Chinese tourist Amy was taking a bus to the center of the Israeli vortex.

;

;Amy loves traveling and has always been curious about the religious Middle Eastern countries. In previous years, she has been to Egypt and Turkey, and the destinations of this trip are Jordan and Israel. Amy and her husband plan to enter Israel from Jordan so that the two countries can play together and "it is also very convenient to apply for a visa on arrival."

;

;In addition to Amy and her husband, there was also a young Arab-American carpooling together. According to the plan, the group was going to take the border crossing in central Jordan, but after the raid, the crossing was temporarily closed.

;

;“When the driver said he couldn’t go, we couldn’t believe it and insisted on going over to find out, but there were also police stopping us on the road. When we saw the bloody scene displayed by the driver, the three of us were shocked. "Amy said.

;

;The Israeli-Palestinian conflict has been going on for a long time, and Amy and her group didn’t take it seriously at first. As more and more news of the conflict came in, they decided to abandon their original plan and proceed via the northern border crossing instead. "Time was very tight, and we couldn't think too much. Coupled with the language barrier, the driver said no matter what, so we went along," Amy said.

;

;The northern Jordanian border crossing is relatively remote and sparsely populated. Amy and her husband wanted to find someone to carpool with and asked multiple transit passengers, but they were all rejected. When Amy was about to call the insurance company for help, they "miraculously" hailed a taxi on a street farther away.

;

;"At that time, people at the border crossing were saying that it was impossible to fly today, and we were worried that the flight would be cancelled. In addition, it was the Sabbath and there were few people going to work, so we were also worried that we would not be able to get to the airport on time." Go to On the way to the airport, Amy and her husband repeatedly called the airline to confirm whether the plane was taking off normally. At the same time, they had to call the insurance company to inquire about the claim settlement. "They were on tenterhooks all the way."

;

;They arrived at the airport at 3:30 pm and saw many passengers waiting in line. "Thankfully, I checked in early. If I missed my flight, it would be more difficult to return home in the future," Amy said.

;

;Amy’s worries are not unfounded.

;

;After the raid, Delta Air Lines and American Airlines canceled flights from New York to Israel scheduled for the 7th and 8th. Lufthansa also announced on the 7th that it would significantly cancel flights to Tel Aviv. In addition, the Feichangzhun App shows that the recent round-trip flights from Shanghai and Shenzhen in China to Tel Aviv in Israel have also been cancelled.

;

;Unlike Amy's "multiple countries in one day", Liu Zihui took a flight home the day after the attack.

;

;Early in the morning on the 8th, Liu Zihui packed her luggage. According to the plan, they will fly from Ben Gurion International Airport to the capital Beijing. After arriving at the airport, Liu Zihui found that although there were many people, they were in good order. During the exchange, Liu Zihui discovered that some people arrived on the first day because they were afraid that the airport would be closed.

;

;The big flight screen was all red, leaving only sporadic green. "A large number of flights have been cancelled, and only a few are flying normally."

;

;It wasn't until the plane took off that Liu Zihui's hanging heart fell to the ground, and she fell into a deep sleep for the rest of the journey. At 5:28 a.m. on October 9, the plane landed at Beijing Capital International Airport, and warm applause erupted in the cabin.

;

;"I saw the bright lights on the ground in Beijing through the port window, and I felt a little excited. I have landed countless times, and I have never been as excited as today." Liu Zihui said.

;

;;Unfortunate news;

;

;Not everyone can evacuate as smoothly as Amy and Liu Zihui.

;

;On the morning of October 9, staff of Jiangsu Zhonglan Overseas Employment Company, which engages in overseas labor dispatch business, told Southern Weekend reporters that as of 11 a.m. that day, the company knew that three people were missing in Israel, and the others were missing. The situation is still being updated.

;

;On October 10, a spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and relevant embassies and consulates abroad have issued safety reminders in response to the current situation in Israel and Palestine, advising Chinese citizens not to travel to Israel and Palestine for the time being. Local Chinese citizens and institutions remain highly vigilant, strengthen safety precautions, prepare for emergencies and take shelter on site.

;

;Millit experienced a "near escape" while attending the music festival.

;

;According to Milliet’s account on social platforms, she and her friends initially fled in a car. When they crossed a main road, they encountered a double attack from the attackers.

;

;"Someone was screaming and attackers were shooting at people who were going there, so I turned around as fast as I could. Two minutes later, I saw there were more attackers going in the other direction," she said.

;

;Later, Millet and her friends escaped in the wilderness. After about three hours, weak and frightened, they hid in the bushes and covered themselves with leaves. During this period, they tried to call the police, but the police did not respond.

;

;Millet's experience has attracted the attention of many media, and the "Washington Post" quoted her experience in a report on October 8.

;

;After the attack, the organizers of the "Parallel Universe" music festival issued a bilingual announcement in Hebrew and English to search for missing persons. Comment sections on social platforms are crowded with anxious people. They kept leaving messages asking about their missing relatives and friends.

;

;"We are shocked and pained." The organizer "New Star Tribe" said in the announcement that it is making every effort to assist the security forces in searching for missing persons in the area. The organization also provides an online missing person statistics form, where family members can upload their details.

;

;"We pray that good news will come to you and me soon," the announcement said.

;

;Also close to the border with the Gaza Strip, the young Israeli scholar Haim Ketzman died in his home in Holit. On October 8, Katzman’s mother announced the news on social platforms.

;

;Kettsman is a young scholar engaged in Israel studies. His resume is still hanging on the official website of the University of Washington. It can be seen from this that he studied for bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees at the Open University of Israel, Ben-Gurion University, and the University of Washington. His research interests include Israeli religion and politics. Katzman’s mother, Hannah, works for an Israeli NGO. After Katzman was killed, the organization also publicly mourned on social platforms.

;

;From the information released by Ketzman’s mother, it can be seen that at first she mistakenly believed that Ketzman had been “kidnapped”. For this reason, she also posted missing person information on social platforms. When the bad news came, the missing person information was corrected, "He died at home."

;

;Avital Alajem, Katzman’s neighbor and friend, was interviewed by CNN on October 9. She said Ketzman hid in the closet with her when Hamas militants broke in and shot her. She herself was not injured in the attack and "Katzman saved my life."

;

;Kettsman received the 2019 "Kimmerlin Best Graduate Thesis Award" from the Israel Studies Association. The award honors the memory of Baruch Kimmerling, an Israeli public intellectual and sociologist.

;

;In the winning essay, Ketzman had this speech: Dedicated to all forms of life between the Jordan River and the Mediterranean Sea.

;

;Ketzmann’s friend Marwa Maziad wrote in her eulogy, “He truly believed that all life forms were equal and beautiful, including the plants in his care. Israel /Palestine, Arab-Muslim/Jewish, may his soul rest in peace."

;

;(Liu Zihui, Zhang Feng, and Amy are pseudonyms, Southern Weekend interns Xu Ziyi, Bao Jingyue, and Zhai Huan also contributed to this article)

;

;;Young people who were once considered the most individualistic, advocating instant gratification, and embracing "consumerism" have begun to quietly save money and clock in. I don't know when. A saving trend is taking over social media. ;

;

;;How hard can young people of this generation work to save money? It can be said that only you can’t think of it, but there is nothing young people can’t do. ;

;

;;;The new hobby of contemporary people: not consuming, but saving money like crazy;;

;

;;;In Between going to work and making progress, this generation of young people choose incense; between buying bags and getting drunk, they are more likely to choose to buy lottery tickets; between ideals and reasons, financial management is the favorite of young people - the main thing is One saves money and makes money! ;;

;

;;Douban's "Living with Interest: Savings Group" now has more than 100,000 members in the group, "Living with Interest: Investment and Financial Management" group , the number of team members exceeds 600,000. Not to mention the "Stingy Women's Association" and the "Stingy Men's Association", with a total of millions of people joining the groups. ;

;

;;In order to save money, some people choose to keep accounts and plan carefully, some choose to live with interest, manage finances and buy funds, and some choose to do both their main business and side business, and become a slash youth. ;

;

;;When using the accounting APP, sorting out personal bills regularly is just an entry-level step. Learn from the collective wisdom of various money-saving groups and discover various wool-gathering artifacts, shopping red envelopes, Membership discounts, point deductions, live group buying, multi-platform price comparisons, and resolutely not letting go of any hidden benefits are the new life wisdom that young people get. For example, there are young people who squat after midnight every day to grab expired food and leftovers. boxes to reduce the cost of food expenses. ;

;

;;These are the evolved actions of young people, and students at higher levels have already started saving money by playing special forces. Compare banks across the country to see whose interest rates are better. Higher, choose to travel thousands of miles to go. Some media reported that after bank interest rates were lowered this year, some young people traveled 2,000 kilometers a day and spent 330 yuan on fares just to earn an extra 1,800 yuan in interest. ;

;

;;Some people feel that this is too unfair to themselves. The reason why young people are happy to live in peace with the "hard life" is that there is a high probability that saving money will snowball and see themselves The small treasury is getting fuller day by day, and the sense of accomplishment can, to a certain extent, make people forget the hardships in the early days. ;

;

;;As the Japanese writer Yataro Matsuura once wrote in "Getting Rich Slowly: Money and Work Rules to Make Your Life Richer": "It is easier to save money than to spend it. After all, there are many ways to spend money, but there is only one way to save money, and that is to 'spend less'." Because the path is single and clear, as long as the goal is firm enough and you continue in the established direction, you will always succeed. Realization, and therefore, attracts more and more young people to join the game. ;

;

;;Rejecting the trap of consumerism, young people have truly become sober in the world. I am no longer obsessed with following trends and buying the latest electronic products; I no longer order takeout frequently, but choose to go to the market with the aunts to buy food and bring my own meals; I no longer have to take a taxi every time I walk, but can walk. Walk, take the subway and never take a taxi. The money saved at every step is like a trickle, which eventually converges into a stream or a river. ;

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo /图）;

;

;;< span>;Saving money, can you save money;;

;

;;So when it comes to saving money, to what extent do young people hope to save money? A report shows that more than 53.7% of 30-year-olds believe that saving 100,000 yuan can be regarded as having a certain basis for savings. ;

;

;;However, the cold reality is that a survey by China Business News shows: with a deposit of more than 100,000 yuan, you have already surpassed 53.7% of your peers. More than half of young people have less than 100,000 in savings, and it is a reality that they are "powerless". Young people who are trying their best to save money find that money is like fine sand. The tighter you hold it, the more it will be lost. ;

;

;;The road to financial freedom is full of thorns. However, the will of young people is gradually firming up, and they are no longer attracted by the lavish spending of consumerism. Instead, they do not want to buy and save everything, and everything is compromised for the enrichment of their small coffers. What social trends does it reflect that young people are working hard to save money? Some people's ambition to save money is to retire early and implement a FIRE plan (Financial Independence, Retire Early); others are saving money for more security and more confidence to cope with the future. ;

;

;;After all, the greater the balance, the greater the sense of security. Money means having enough protection against unknown risks. It can help young people live without panic and ask for help less when encountering problems. In the final analysis, it is essentially due to the inherent risk aversion. ;

;

;;As Ulrich Beck said in "Risk Society", life risks are always present, and individuals are forced to face the individualization process, which is constructed in the early modernization stage. The security system can no longer provide protection for individuals, and individualization has therefore entered a new stage. ;

;

;;Increased social mobility, the increasingly blurred boundaries between unemployment and employment, the disintegration of clan-based family relationships, work and intimate relationships, all of which are unavoidable issues for this generation of young people. Making young people aware of risks also inspires their desire to cling to something stable when the wave of risks strikes, so as to seek peace and tranquility in their own years. But before the dawn of dawn, money becomes the coordinate axis of reality, and saving money is the magic weapon for young people to resist risks. ;

;

;;If you think that young people save money without spending it, you are totally wrong. Different from the older generation who simply save money, young people focus on saving money and spending money when they should. In this Houlang’s value perception, saving money is to spend money better, to spend money wisely, and to pursue a higher sense of value and cost-effectiveness. ;

;

;;Bill Gates once said: "It is as difficult to spend a sum of money wisely as to earn it." Therefore, if you feel it is worthwhile, travel to see the world and learn New skills and new experiences are worth saving money to achieve. However, if you feel that it is not worth it, such as a takeaway meal that has increased in price, or expensive ugly clothes in the mall, then you are not willing to pay extra for it. ;

;

;;Young people who often surf the Internet have given various "painless money saving" methods a new title, naming them "Princess Money Saving Method" "365-day money saving method" "Muyu money saving method"...;

;

;;Even in order to increase the sense of ritual of saving money, when achieving the goal, you will appropriately increase yourself Rewards, such as saving 50 yuan a day and saving up money for a concert ticket in three months, will not affect your normal living standards, but at the same time, you can satisfy your hobbies and interests, just like making a coin-operated wish, in the wilderness of life Here, brave people are at the forefront, enjoying the world first and creating their own unique style and lifestyle. ;

;

;;Bulk up your wallet and enrich your life. Are you in love with this young generation’s view on saving money? ;

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 11:25:04 +0800 主持人实名举报，法院12368热线能不能外包？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258377
;;2023-10-11 11:13:55;
;

;;

;

;Moderator Zhang Zequn. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;On October 7, 2023, CCTV host Zhang Zequn reported to the Chaoyang District Court in Beijing with his real name on social media. He said in multiple updates that the court's 12368 litigation service hotline was outsourced, and "the staff did not know what a collegiate bench was, and there was dereliction of duty."

;

;Immediately, Zhang Zequn’s report became a hot search topic, attracting the attention of netizens.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found that outsourcing of the court’s 12368 hotline is relatively common. According to a cursory search, dozens of courts at the provincial, municipal, and county levels across the country , there is a phenomenon of public bidding for hotline outsourcing services.

;

;Some netizens raised questions about the functions, responsibilities and positioning of the 12368 hotline. What is "12368"? Can it be outsourced?

;

;"In order to meet the multi-level and diverse judicial needs of the people, the People's Court has established a 12368 litigation service hotline and vigorously promoted the 'one-stop service' work." Supreme Court Liu Xuemei, deputy director of the filing division of the People's Court, once told the media that as of the end of 2022, all four levels of courts across the country had opened a 12368 litigation service hotline, helping to resolve an average of 59,000 claims every day.

;

;;

;

;As of the end of 2022, the national All four levels of courts have opened litigation service hotlines, and an average of 59,000 claims are resolved every day. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;“Send a work order to the judge”

;

;Public information shows that "12368" is the number determined by the Supreme People's Court. Judicial information public welfare service number common to the national court system. Beijing is the first pilot area for the "12368" judicial service hotline, which was officially opened on January 7, 2009. The "Beijing Court 12368 Hotline" has set up a main platform in the Beijing High Court, and has set up sub-platforms in all middle and grassroots courts. Six courts, namely Dongcheng, Xicheng, Chaoyang, Haidian, Fengtai and Daxing, have set up direct dial lines and do not need to be forwarded through the Municipal High Court's main platform; calls from other court sub-platforms will be uniformly answered and accepted by the Municipal High Court's main platform, and will be forwarded according to the situation of the call. The case shall be handled by the lower court on separate platforms.

;

;According to the "Rule of Law Daily" report in 2021, the 12368 direct sub-platform of Xicheng Court consists of 5 lines, and staff will receive more than 200 calls every day , looking for judges, investigating cases, answering questions, receiving opinions, making demands, etc. According to the relevant person in charge of the Beijing High Court, if parties call the 12368 hotline to ask for simple matters such as checking the progress of the case, submitting applications and materials, and procedural litigation consultation, the hotline will "answer the lawsuit" as soon as possible and give a direct reply; If the exercise of judicial power or matters closely related to the case require a response from the judge, the hotline will issue a work order to the judge, who will handle it in a timely manner within the specified time limit to ensure that the contact rate of the judge reaches 100%.

;

;Zhang Zequn reported to the Chaoyang Court 12368 hotline. On October 8 and 9, 2023, Southern Weekend reporters called the hotline several times to inquire about the "collegial panel" and hotline outsourcing. On one occasion, the operator responded that he could ask the judge about the legal terms and the circumstances in which they appeared, and he would give a reply within two days. Another time, the operator replied that 12368 is mainly responsible for registering complaint information and cannot directly handle complaints.

;

;Another call occurred at around 8 pm. The artificial intelligence voice assistant provided a self-service intelligent voice query service. When the keyword "Collegial Court" was mentioned , gave a more detailed answer. However, artificial intelligence voice assistants may have unclear or inaccurate hearing from time to time, and if there is a semantic recognition error, they will continue to output large sections of legal or procedural regulations and cannot be interrupted manually.

;

;"The role of 12368 focuses on information consultation." A lawyer surnamed Liu told a Southern Weekend reporter that the customer service line of the 12368 hotline mainly relies on the query system. No special professional answering ability is required; more professional questions related to court functions can mainly be completed by calling the legal aid hotline 12348 or going to the court case filing window. Lawyer Liu often interacts with courts and does legal knowledge popularization work on Internet platforms in his spare time.

;

;He also introduced that many parties involved in the case have little contact with the court and do not understand the existence of 12368. In contrast, lawyers entrusted by parties are the group who have more contact with the 12368 hotline. For lawyers, 12368 is mainly used to understand the progress of the case and to inquire about other channels for detailed consultation.

;

;;Outsourcing is more common;

;

;April 2023, Beijing The "Beijing Higher People's Court 12368 Hotline Litigation Platform Service Fee Project Winning Announcement" published by the Municipal Government Procurement Network revealed that China Mobile Online Services Co., Ltd. won the bid for "Beijing Higher People's Court 12368 Hotline Litigation Platform Service" at a price of 7.74972 million yuan. "Fees Project", the service period is 12 months.

;

;Introducing the "overall model" in the announcement, the 12368 manual hotline service adopts the access model of the main platform of the High Court and the sub-platforms of the middle and grassroots courts to provide the society with 5× 8 hours service. The bidder provides workplace wiring services, as well as operation team recruitment, training, management, call quality inspection, callback, etc. The number of seats in the operation team shall not be less than 65, and there shall be no less than one full-time call quality inspector.

;

;According to media reports, in 2022, the number of manual calls to the Beijing Court’s 12368 hotline reached 1.4942 million, a year-on-year increase of 67.2%, ranking first in the country.

;

;"You will know after going to the court a few times to do things. They really have a lot of things to do and are very busy." Wang Cailiang, director of Beijing Cailiang Law Firm, once organized lawyers to go to the court. The "Legal Aid Hotline 12348" of the judicial system provides free consultation. He explained to Southern Weekend reporters that it is very common not only in the court system, but also in some government agencies and institutions to outsource hotlines involving legal issues.

;

;He said that if normal bidding procedures are followed, this kind of outsourcing behavior is not a bad idea. The key is that the legal professionalism of the outsourcing unit must be excellent so that it will not be criticized by the outside world. "If you are not professional, wrong and knowledgeable, you will not be able to satisfy the masses," he said.

;

;"Many people are unwilling to do consultations and receive public consultations." Wang Cailiang explained that staff in some units regard receiving public consultations as a kind of burden and therefore tend to outsource this work. He believes that communication and consultation are originally good opportunities to resolve conflicts. If used as a burden, conflicts will accumulate and expand, thus consuming more judicial resources.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter's search found that the outsourcing of "12368" is common in courts at all levels across the country, but the specific bidding details vary greatly. Due to different levels of economic development, the business volume of courts in various regions varies greatly, and the contract amounts therefore vary significantly.

;

;For example, a provincial high court in an economically underdeveloped southern province issued a bidding announcement in July 2023, which showed that its “12368 litigation service hotline outsourcing The project's budget is only 600,000 yuan; while the contracting budget of another large city district court in March 2023 reached 1.5 million yuan. In addition to the separate bidding model for each court, a province in East China has adopted a model of "provincial centralized deployment and social outsourcing of the 12368 litigation service hotline of the province's courts", with an overall budget of more than 24 million yuan, requiring intelligent voice, intelligent work orders, Intelligent agent assistance and a unified litigation service knowledge base empower the core engine, open up the litigation service system, and realize the entire process of consultation, inquiry, appointment, and processing.

;

;The contract period of these outsourcing services usually ranges from 1 to 3 years, and subcontracting and subcontracting are expressly prohibited. Among the winning bidders, state-owned enterprises and private enterprises It’s both.

;

;"Currently, there are no regulations that clearly allow or prohibit outsourcing." Wu Liwei, a lawyer at Beijing Beidou Dingming Law Firm, often calls the court hotline because he needs to check the progress of the case. Consultation was conducted, but I felt that many outsourcers did not understand legal issues. "Since it is a litigation service hotline, it is to facilitate parties, lawyers and other people who may be involved in the lawsuit to understand relevant legal issues and litigation processes. From this function, internal court personnel should be responsible for answering calls and answering questions."

;

;In addition, Wu Liwei also believes that outsourcing the court hotline may involve leaking privacy. He explained that lawyers and clients often need to call the hotline to inquire about the progress of the case. Although the specific details of the case will not be involved, the "cause of the case" itself contains a lot of private information. "For example, who files a divorce lawsuit against whom, and who sues whom for defamation, insult, or damage to reputation, all involve the privacy of the parties involved."

;A few days ago, a netizen told an experience of his on social media, which caused widespread attention and controversy. The blogger herself described the version as follows: She said she had a "facial fracture" and was beaten by her parents. The reason was that she felt that her parents looked like human traffickers, and her sense of justice was overwhelming. In the end, the two parties went to the police station.

;

;She wrote: At the police station...it was said that I hit him with a pole first, and then he hit me. In fact, I just followed them from beginning to end, constantly asking the little girl: "Kid, is he a member of your family?" Once or twice I tried to gently hold her hand to confirm with her what the relationship between this man and her was. The little girl didn't say anything, and I didn't dare to confirm whether he was a trafficker, so I kept delaying time and told him to stop and not leave. My purpose was to wait until the police came to investigate clearly. He was too fierce, and I was afraid that he would beat him. I.

;

;Then he was really beaten: Later, when he walked near his car, he suddenly put down the child, turned around and punched me on the head several times... and broke the handle (of the camper) with all his strength. He hit me on the head with the broken end of the metal handle...

;

;On this Weibo, there are those who sympathize and support, but also those who ridicule and ridicule. Of course, what we can see so far is the blogger’s unilateral perspective and description, which may not be accurate or complete. To understand the full truth, the media should interview the other party or ask the local police for information.

;

;If the subject of the facts described by the blogger is true, that is, he is well-intentioned, suspects that the parents are human traffickers, and then follows them, talks to the child, and "once or twice tried to gently hold her hand." "Hand", because the child kept silent, "I had to keep stalling for time to tell him to stop and not leave." This is one party’s perspective. What if we look at it from the perspective of the child’s father?

;

;As a father, he carried his child to a private car. Suddenly a stranger appeared and was following me. He also approached the child and kept saying incomprehensible words. He also tried to touch his child and questioned whether he was the child's biological father. A normal reaction would be to get angry.等走到自己汽车附近，感觉孩子安全了，决定教训一下对方，让孩子知道父亲会保护自己，也出出心中的恶气。

;

;应该说，保护自己的孩子，是任何一个为人父母者的正常反应。有陌生人不断持续此种言行，在带着孩子的父母看来就是挑衅，或存心不良。至于小孩不回答陌生人的问话，也很正常了，或者性格内向，或者由于学校或家庭的安全教育，不愿跟来历不明的陌生人搭话。

;

;坊间流传：人贩子为了从父母手中抢走小孩，一个套路就是乘父母不注意一把从父母手中夺走小孩，然后对留驻的路人谎称自己才是小孩的父母，或谎称是夫妻之间闹矛盾抢小孩，以打消路人干预的念头，这样路人干预的意愿就下降了。而这些都市传说（Urban Legend），其实都是有所本的。

;

;一位父亲发视频介绍，2023年7月13日晚，他妻子带孩子出去玩，一名女子直接要抢孩子，还好自己离孩子不远才及时制止，“女子一直对别人说是她的小孩，旁边的人都不敢插手，后面她想跑，我把她制服了”。根据当地警方通报：涉事女子有多次精神疾病就医治疗史。虽然该女子被证实是精神病而非人贩子，但抢孩子时用了“是她的孩子”的说法。

;

;神智正常者当众抢人孩子的也有。 2019年12月17日，王女士和母亲带着2岁的双胞胎儿女来到上海站，准备乘车回郑州老家。当她们在车站东南出口处休息时，一名推着婴儿车、身穿黑色外套的中年女子在大庭广众之下，竟然抱起了她的小女儿准备离开。王女士和周围旅客急忙将该女子拦下，并立即报了警，该女子谎称“抱错了”。

;

;回到文章开头的案例，其逻辑链条较大的可能是：该女子认为小孩父亲疑似人贩子；反过来，小孩父亲恐怕也把她当疑似人贩子或精神病，这就导致了一场基于双向误解的冲突。涉事博主的出发点值得肯定，但实际上，一个大人抱着小孩在街上走，从“先验概率”（prior probability）看，是父母抱着自己孩子的概率还是极高的。同时，也没有道理说父母带着孩子在外面必须随时随地保持亲密互动才是正常的。如果被抱着的小孩大哭大闹说要妈妈，明确说了“你是谁，我不认识你，我要妈妈”。那才确实是有些可疑的。

;

;而这一事件也提醒我们，有爱心、有正义感是好事，但应该从常识与理性出发，基于可靠判断、在维护自身安全的前提下挺身而出；遇见确实的可疑情况，也不要直接跟对方起冲突，最好用法律手段解决问题。见义勇为当然应该提倡，但必须客观上真的在见义勇为，例如阻止了现行犯。如果误判了事情的性质，实际上在侵犯别人的人身自由与名誉权利，难免衍生出误判与错误行动的后果，这是孰是孰非之外的启示所在。

;

;;2023-10-11 09:00:00;
;

;;

;

;2023年9月12日下午，上海，宜家餐厅里的老年人。 （南方周末记者郑丹/图）

;

;一席饭散，9个人，13样菜，人均结算现钞72元。擦擦嘴起身，一天又消磨过去了。

;

;68岁的洪建明站在霓虹灯通明的饭店大堂前，看着老友们三两结伴，互相搀扶着穿过斑马线，直至消失在马路对面的黑暗里，他才迈出步子。 “他们都不知道我住在这附近，不想让他们知道。”

;

;他们，是洪建明在上海徐家汇的宜家餐厅认识的单身老人，冲着“多吃几个花样的菜”，每个礼拜二聚在一起吃饭。彼此都不知道姓名，也很少过问，因为没必要。

;

;到宜家餐厅的单身老人，大多是想找个伴。他们一面冲着心仪对象大胆示爱，一面又出于自我保护止不住地猜疑与提防，唯恐吃了亏。日子久了，大家变成了保有边界感的熟人，聚一块只是图个热闹。

;

;孤独，终归是这里的底色。

;

;自留地

;

;“缺乏一个老年人交流平台”

;

;初秋的上海阴雨连绵，但位于漕溪路126号的宜家家居徐汇商场人声鼎沸。在礼拜二和礼拜四的午后，二楼餐厅里用餐的年轻人慢慢散去，乌泱泱的老年人就涌进来了。

;

;2023年9月12日下午3时，南方周末记者初到宜家餐厅，一眼望过去，布置近700个座位的用餐区，被零散坐开的老年人完全占据，过道里始终有人走动，相互搭讪聊天。偶尔有人走到记者跟前，打量着年轻的新面孔问道：“是来找伴的不？”

;

;这是一处上海老年人自发设定的相亲角。开业于1998年的徐汇商场，是宜家在中国大陆的第一家门店。很难说清楚，它的餐厅是怎么被一群老来单身的人相中并占据的。只要购买一杯7.9元的咖啡，免费续杯，就可以端着马克杯在餐厅晃荡一整天。

;

;71岁的陈翠霞记得，18年前，徐汇商场还是一栋很小的两层楼，单身的她和姐妹6人来玩，底下商场兜一圈，发现二楼还有饭吃。 “这边蛮好的，完了以后我们就讲好，下次再来好不好？”

;

;后来，人越聚越多，最多的时候，三百多号单身老人聚过来，都是来找伴的，整个大厅得靠喊话沟通，“声音吵;得;能把房顶掀翻”。有人提出，大家挑日子聚，周二是大日子，周四是小日子。陈翠霞觉得，老人们其实没有其他地方可以去聊天;。 ;“除了这里，就是人民公园，缺乏一个供老年人交流的平台。”

;

;上海是全国老龄化程度最高的超大型城市。据2022年上海市老年人口和老龄事业监测统计信息公布数据，2022年上海户籍的60岁及以上老年人口553.66万人，占总人口近;四;成，其中，独居老年人数30.06万。

;

;宜家餐厅无疑成了他们排遣寂寞的一块自留地。每周二，一位90岁的老太太会乘坐456路公交，从三林出发，花40多分钟时间来到餐厅后，只是默默坐在角落看人头攒动；旁边另一位上了年纪的女人与老太太以姐妹相称，她用塑料袋包些南瓜子给老太太吃，俩人自打在餐厅认识至今已有四五年之久。当被问及是不是来找伴时，她们摇摇头，“就聊天，阿拉（上海话，我们）开心就好。”

;

;张贵成则从更远的地方赶来，他每周二从奉贤区出发，要坐两个半小时公交和地铁，到这里唠嗑、吃饭，再回去，一天七八十元没了，只是因为孤单。

;

;71岁的他是上海人民公园的媒人出身，干了几十年，如今也面临找不到伴的困境。 “老年人相亲跟年轻人相亲一样，都是做生意，你条件好不好？有多少钱？”

;

;张贵成说，跟所有相亲角一样，这里最重要的条件也是钱。大家的开场白，无外乎是几个问题：你是上海人吗？多大年纪了？有儿女吗？有劳保（退休金）吗？有房子吗？

;

;一个65岁的老太太告诉张贵成，自己想要50万元彩礼，张贵成也把这套问题抛给她：有劳保吗？没有；有房子吗？ nor.张贵成一句话没憋住，“你啥都没有，人为啥给你50万，你就是不要彩礼，也没人要你的。”

;

;;鄙视链;

;

;“老太婆、老头子领证亏的嘞”

;

;表面看上去，来宜家餐厅的都是顶有钱的老年人，明晃晃的金首饰是这里最不缺的装饰品。男人们大多穿着短袖，腰间的皮带上戴一串钥匙，显得规规矩矩；有个性一点的，喜欢倒戴一顶鸭舌帽，将短袖的领子立起来；一个男人时常穿一身颜色鲜艳的衣服，上面标有的大logo和花纹使得他财气外露，他称自己已经在这里交过七八个女朋友了。

;

;女人们也掌握了时尚的秘诀，墨镜、丝巾和旗袍都是提升气质的必备品。还有人以苗条身段吸引众人目光，用黑色口罩遮住爬满皱纹的脸，多了一丝神秘感。另一个来自甘肃的六旬女人戴一顶缝有硕大花朵的紫色礼帽，说话温声细语，满含微笑，但因为她是外地人，至今没有找到伴。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月21日，上海宜家餐厅，两位年过六十的女性合影。 （南方周末记者郑丹/图）

;

;只要在宜家餐厅待一个下午，就会明显感受到老年人相亲圈子里的鄙视链。有房子且退休金高的上海男人在这里最受欢迎，再讲究一点的，对上海各个区的人也能分出个三六九等。至于女人们，年轻漂亮的上海人就是香饽饽，有些退休金最好不过。外来人不论男女，都处在鄙视链的底端，会被怀疑别有用心。

;

;过往的教训告诉这里的老人们，“陷阱”是五花八门的。在老人们的讲述中，有男人穿金戴银，谎称自己家中富得流油，只是为了和“上钩”的女人睡一觉；有女人称自己身体健康，等在一起后才暴露出浑身是病，男伴不得不天天领着她跑医院；还时常有一些外地的年轻女人来到这个地方，专盯八九十岁、无儿无女的单身上海男人“谈朋友”。

;

;宋小飞就是大家口中“中招”的“糊涂人”，一个80岁的老中医，清瘦，嘴角弥留一道黏糊的食物残渣。 40多岁的王秀敏坐在对面为他剥桂圆，两人几个月前才走到一起，因为年龄差距悬殊，对外以父女相称。

;

;宋小飞每月领取8000元的退休金，这在餐厅属于相当高的档次。退休金全部交由王秀敏保管，宋小飞每天会分到50元零花钱，被他卡进退役军人优待证的夹层里，用来买烟。

;

;王秀敏说，她心疼宋小飞的经历。宋小飞经历过三次失败的婚姻，第一个老婆让他痛苦了18年。两人离婚后，女方娘家的房子分了一套给宋小飞。这套房子在第二次婚姻中被分出一半，直至第三次婚姻结束后，房子彻底分没了，如今宋小飞只能在上海租一处房子住。

;

;第三任老婆，就是宋小飞在宜家餐厅认识的;。 ;“她说她有三套房子，我们打了结婚证，后来才知道，她一套都没有。”宋小飞果断离了婚，又成了孤身一人。 “第三个良心很凶的，我现在就想找个良心好的。”宋小飞看了旁边的王秀敏，“她良心就蛮好的”;。 ;

;

;王秀敏形容宋小飞的遭遇，是牛变成羊子，羊子变成鸡蛋，最后鸡蛋壳都没了。宋小飞听了笑笑，“无所谓，我看得很透的，混到哪天算哪天，走了都是一场空了”;。 ;

;

;为了避免坠入“陷阱”，老人们最常用的方式，就是不打结婚证，也不让渡房产证的名字。

;

;以前，王立仁在餐厅里谈过一个漂亮的女伴，“刚开始处得蛮好，后来她让我往房产证上提个她名字。我说要是没有儿子，死了以后三套房子全部给你，但我有儿子”;。 ;最后，考虑到俩人已经睡过觉了，王立仁给了女伴2000元作为弥补，女伴攥着钱愤愤地离开了。

;

;谁也不愿意自己的财产在暮年时被人分割。 “老太婆、老头子之间谈得不好，领证亏的嘞！比如你有50万，想离婚了，你就要给她25万。”一个男人挑起眉毛，以老;到;的口吻说，自己早就看透了眼前的这帮女人。一旁的女人听这话不乐意了，她更支持流行的一句话：不以结婚为目的的恋爱，都是耍流氓。

;

;有人拿餐厅中有一对成功的伴侣举例：男方的经济条件不如女方，但退休金高，便将退休金全部交给女人，住进了女方的家。几年过去，俩人没打结婚证，感情也好好的。 “彼此有个伴儿就行了，不打证也一样过。”

;

;孤独感

;

;“我就为儿子把自己卖了”

;

;餐厅里的常客老张，也是宜家餐厅出了名的“糊涂人”，被一些老人形容是“捣糨糊的”（方言，形容瞎混），也捣坏了餐厅的风气。

;

;他78岁了，牙齿已经掉完，要靠布满黑色牙根的牙床摩擦进食，只能吃土豆泥和流食，嚼一小口炸鸡排，需要缓慢咀嚼七八十次才能完全吞咽，软软的下巴牵动松弛的脖颈皮肤一上一下，沉甸甸的金链子跟着闪动。

;

;大家习惯管他叫“小裁缝”，这是他穷苦时代的标签。以前在服装厂工作时没钱，他成宿在离厂子近的澡堂子里过夜。但8年前，因为上海的老房子动迁，老张拿到了500万拆迁款，一夜暴富，围在他身边的女人开始多了起来。

;

;老张图便宜，花了150万在江苏启东买了两套92平米的房。几乎每半个月都要从宜家餐厅带走一个女伴，搭客车回启东看房子，他管这种女人叫“临时工”。

;

;“我花钱买人陪我，照顾我，给我做饭，洗衣服，一天200到1000块钱。”老张说，他会根据年龄和长相定价，越年轻漂亮的，越贵，“年轻的四十多（岁），要睡一起，搂搂抱抱的”;。 ;

;

;48岁的沈素芬就是老张叫过来的“临时工”，她伺候过老张一段时间，一天300元。有一回，到老张启东的房子里，臭味熏天，冰箱里的东西放了一两个月，都是老张在外面吃饭打包带回来的。蚊虫、蛾子快要把天花板扑满，沈素芬足足收拾了三天。

;

;“我女儿不管我，忙。”每隔两三个月，女儿会来看老张一次，给一沓3000元现钞，老张把这些钱全部挥霍在了人生三大爱好上：咖啡，麻将和女人。 “每天一个人很孤独的，身边有一个人，最起码丰富一点。”其实老张最担心的是，如果有一天自己病倒了，身边连个打120的人都没有。

;

;;;;

;

;2023年9月20日，老张准备从上海坐公交回启东。 （南方周末记者郑丹/图）

;

;发生在宜家餐厅里的相亲故事，并不全是情情爱爱，其中一些老人为下一代活着，又被下一代抛弃。

;

;过去很长一段时间，餐厅里有一个漂亮的女人四处找伴，1975年生人，对要找的男人不限年龄和长相，唯一的条件就是给她两百万元。

;

;之所以提这样的要求，是因为儿子临近结婚，凑不够钱。只要有了200万元，就足够在儿媳的老家置备一套房子和车子，;彩;礼也够付。女人说，“我就为儿子做这么一件事情，把自己卖了。”后来，她成为老人们口中的“神经病”，再没来过。

;

;洪建明讲起另一个故事，一个穿着绿色连衣裙的上海单身女人，时常流连于餐厅。 10年前，女儿让她在家里帮忙带小孩，现在小孩带大了，女儿女婿都要她出去住。找了几年伴，没人要她，如今仍住在女儿家。

;

;“她亲口跟我说，她们是两房一厅，房子大，等女儿一家都睡觉了，她悄悄地进去，洗漱完睡觉，不跟他们见面。”说话间，洪建明招手让女人过来聊天，女人摆摆手。 “她脑子已经坏掉了，没别的想法，就是找个老头带她回家住。”

;

;老面孔

;

;“成不了对象，至少有共同话题”

;

;傍晚5点过后，老人们起身陆续回家，68岁的潘银花选了一个角落位置孤零零地坐着，她摆开从家里带来的冷馒头，接一杯热水，开始用自己的晚餐，“不想回到那个家，看到他就吵吵”;。 ;

;

;他，是潘银花的前夫。他们离婚已经有10年，但谁也不想从房子里搬出去，至今仍做着室友。潘银花希望找个有房子的上海男人结婚，然后从那个家搬出去。 “我刚开始离婚的时候，一门心思想找个好的很方便的，离就离了。没想到这么难找，已经灰心了。”

;

;有一次，潘银花跟一个80岁的男人相互中意，男人带她回家看了一圈，潘银花也比较满意。 “但那房子不是他的，他只有使用权。”潘银花看出来，男人有结伴的想法，“但我看他可怜，没有子女，只想跟他保持朋友关系。他年纪大了，有难处打电话来，我能帮他”;。 ;

;

;最终，80岁的男人被来餐厅的一个四十多岁的沈阳女人看中，他将上海的房子租出去，跟着女人回了东北。 “如果这个女的良心好的话，照顾他多活两年。如果老头倒下来要花大钱，她肯定不花的。”说到底，潘银花还是放心不下，“他跟我很聊得来的，你是记者，你能去沈阳找一下这个老头子吗？”

;

;常来宜家餐厅的人都知道，在这里找对象是顶难的事。老年人的相亲是迅速果断的，在“门当户对”的基础之上，陪伴的作用远大过爱情。按照一贯的流程，只要第一面有眼缘，就意味着过了第一关，一般男方会主动邀请女方去自己家里看看，聊得好就同居，聊得不好，也不要浪费彼此时间。

;

;;

;

;2023年9月21日21时，上海宜家餐厅，剩余3位老人闲聊。 （南方周末记者郑丹/图）

;

;这两年，洪建明已经将七八个相中的人带回家参观，结果都没成。 “怪，怎么怪到这个程度？”而那些被洪建明从宜家餐厅和人民公园带回来的女人，有的皱个眉头，说话的语气让他不舒服，还有的到晚年已经丧失性需求，洪建明就知道不合适了。

;

;往往双方聊半个小时以后，洪建明会客客气气地把对方送到楼下的地铁口，叮嘱她回家慢点。但洪建明最想要的是另一种送客场景：“我跟她说，你自己下去，认识不认识路啊？”这就意味着，洪建明心里;中;意对方了，“我会对她说，以后还要来的，不见得每次我都要到地铁站接你吧？”

;

;为了在自己中意的人出现时，表现自己的用心，洪建明字斟句酌地练习过很多遍“台词”;。 ;“怎么说话，又怎么接话，我都想好了，但没人能让我说出来。”

;

;独居时间长了，洪建明时常觉得自己被遗忘了。在这座拥有超过2418万人口的城市，喧嚣与璀璨都是年轻人的。时间将他推向暮年，伴着强烈的孤独，没有一点办法。面对日复一日的老面孔，成不了对象，索性当朋友唠嗑好了，在固定的日子里聚到一起，至少还有共同的话题，打发时间。

;

;也是因为人到老年，闲来无事，时不时有卖房产和墓地的销售员来到宜家餐厅，组织老年人们去观光，大巴车接送，包一顿免费午餐，一些老人踊跃报名。还有一个老人常年在餐厅发展业务，组织熟络的人抱团去外地旅游，生意不断。

;

;隔三差五，这里会消失一张老面孔。相互问一问，就听见坏消息：有的不再来宜家餐厅的老人，已经离开人世了。

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 08:25:02 +0800 为不上体育课，学生下跪求雨：体育何以与愉悦身心、强健体魄的初衷越来越远？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258260
;;2023-10-10 23:30:00;
;

;One day, on the way home after picking up my son from school, I asked him as usual if he had anything interesting to share with me. , he said something happened before the fourth period of physical education class in the morning. Before the physical education class, a group of boys and girls in my son's class knelt down and prayed for rain, saying, "God bless you, let it rain quickly."

;

;"Kneel down and pray for rain", the first reaction in my mind is the plot in the TV series "Journey to the West". A group of children knelt down to pray for rain in a serious manner. Of course I understood that there was an element of comedy in this, but I also realized an indisputable fact: some children do not like to attend physical education classes. On the one hand, the weather in Guangzhou is very hot. Running, skipping rope, and playing with hula hoops on the scorching playground for forty minutes is very painful or even torturous for most students; more importantly, some children There is a clear resistance to taking physical education classes.

;

;I can’t help but think of the time when I was in school more than thirty years ago. Physical education was, without a doubt, the most popular class, without “one”. During recess or physical education classes in elementary school, we would roll hoops, fold cards, play marbles, hopscotch, shuttlecock, and tug-of-war, and have a great time. Whether you come into the classroom with a red face after playing in the summer or warmed up after playing in the winter, it is always a very happy moment. In junior high school and high school, before the class ends in the morning or afternoon, or before the physical education class, many of our classmates carry table tennis rackets. As soon as the bell rings, the students sitting in the back row of the classroom sprint at the speed of 100 meters. Running to the table tennis table and sitting or lying down on the table tennis table means "we have occupied this table".

;

;PE classes at that time were synonymous with relaxation, happiness, and fun, which perfectly matched the playful nature of children. Times have changed, and today’s physical education classes are far less popular than before. Some students don’t like or even hate physical education classes. What is the root cause?

;

;As we all know, the original intention of physical education classes is to strengthen children's bodies. The "physical fitness" here is not only about physical health and fitness, but also about cultivating the children's perseverance and fearless qualities. It has both physical and psychological implications, both of which are indispensable.

;

;Due to overeating, anorexia, other improper, unscientific, and unreasonable diets, or lack of exercise, or no exercise habits, many children are seriously out of shape, obese or suspected of obesity or frailty. There are not a few children who are suspected of being weak. Out of shape will affect children's learning, social interaction and other aspects to a certain extent. As natural attributes, the body, body shape and body shape will construct and affect children's social attributes, often with negative effects.

;

;In order to effectively solve or alleviate the above-mentioned difficulties and strengthen children's physical exercise, education authorities and schools have begun to pay attention to physical education. The importance of physical education in various subjects is increasing day by day. Not only weekly physical education The number of classes has increased significantly. In some provinces and regions, physical education classes have been officially included in the scope of entrance examinations, and physical education scores have been included in the high school entrance examination subjects.

;

;In order to achieve higher overall results and not lose points along with the sports scores, the original sports items as a casual or optional fun function have been transformed into compulsory compulsory content for students. In other words, taking physical education classes is not to play, not to sweat, not to develop a lifelong habit of exercise, but to take the entrance exam and get a temporary score.

;

;The original intention of including physical education as an examination item is to allow students to develop their moral, intellectual and physical development in an all-round way. The problem is that under such incentives, most students hope to get close to full marks or high scores in physical education. Many students In addition to physical education classroom training, students also spend a lot of time, energy and money on training for physical education examinations. Various expensive training courses, improvement courses and crash courses have sprung up like mushrooms after a rain. There is no difference between these extracurricular training programs for major subjects such as Chinese, Mathematics, and English.

;

;From the school perspective, some areas have implemented a policy that links student physical examinations to the performance of principals, and therefore to the performance of teachers. Therefore, physical education classes and physical tests are not just a matter for the physical education teacher, but also a matter for all teachers in the school, involving the welfare and treatment of all teachers in the school. Under such circumstances, strengthening physical education classes, allowing students to strengthen physical exercise even when they return home, and doing everything possible to improve students' physical test scores has naturally become a common choice for many schools. "Using the whole school's efforts to develop and revitalize sports" has become a goal of many schools. slogan.

;

;Let students strengthen physical exercise. The specific exercise content is very specific and clear, including the physical test items required above. Students have to insist on punching in every day, and ignore other items at all, such as kicking shuttlecock, Projects that are interesting to students or more popular among students, such as hoop rolling and hopscotch, are basically excluded. In other words, the sports that students play in class may not necessarily be what they like. They have no right to choose. They can only passively accept several types of sports designated by the school.

;

;In recent years, some schools in some areas have also popularized activities designed to allow students to exercise for one hour a day - "big break", which specifically includes free exercise, relaxation exercise, running exercise and other sections. The problem is that the evaluation criteria for this kind of "big break" are mainly beautiful formations, which require uniformity in an absolute sense. The row spacing, shoulder distance, arm raising range, left alignment, right alignment, and uniformity throughout the formation are not important. There are strict rules about not allowed to laugh and not allowed to make any sound. Students are forced to spend most of their "recess" time on superficial tasks such as formation rehearsals and pattern displays. Actual sports and exercise time are very limited.

;

;In order to win the "big break" competition, to come out on top in the gymnastics competitions of other schools, to gain greater honors, and to get richer bonuses, some physical education teachers in some schools go to great lengths. Use your brains and find ways to "create". How to "create" is nothing more than working on the formation and making the movements more difficult. For example, inventing a "flexibility exercise" requires students to be proficient in difficult movements such as splits and lower backs. How? Only repeated training once and for all, this kind of high-intensity training brings huge harm to the students' bodies, and some of the damage is irreversible. From a psychological point of view, most students will feel that practicing these innovative exercises is more boring, boring, and uninteresting, and it is extremely painful for them.

;

;The above-mentioned various innovative exercises wearing a fitness "hat" are more difficult and less interesting, and there are fewer practical exercises for students. As a result, if the school radio station broadcasts "Due to ****** reasons, today's recess is temporarily canceled", bursts of cheers will be heard from every classroom on the entire campus.

;

;This is obviously contrary to common sense, because not every student has the physical condition and talent to practice gymnastics, and not every student is suitable for doing difficult movements. This kind of training is only for professional gymnasts. It is really unreasonable to transplant standard machinery to ordinary students. The motivation behind this move - to win awards for the school and to increase the income of the school and some teachers, feels despicable and dirty, which is not an exaggeration.

;

;Standardizing and homogenizing sports, converting physical measurements into results and scores, and linking sports to the performance of school leaders and the pocketbooks of teachers have greatly reduced or obliterated the diversity of sports. The essential stipulations such as sex, diversity, and interest are used to alienate the children into tools for some people to pursue their political achievements. Such behavior is naturally not welcomed by the students.

;

;In short, we cannot oversimplify our understanding of students’ “kneeling down to pray for rain”. We cannot simply attribute it to the fact that today’s children are generally afraid of sweating, suffering, weak willpower, and weak ability to withstand stress. If you don’t like or even hate physical education classes, relevant parties should think about it in all aspects: Is the current function of physical education classes to strengthen your body, please your body and mind, or is it something else?

;

;(The author is a professor at the Department of Sociology, Guangzhou University)

;

;;

;

;Claudia Goldin. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;On October 9, 2023, Beijing time, Claudia Gore, professor of economics at Harvard University Claudia Goldin will win the 2023 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for "advancing our understanding of women's labor market outcomes."

;

;I studied Golding’s economic thought during my Ph.D., and in 2011 published “Review of Claudia Golding’s Economic Thought—Potential Female Nobel Economics” in Economic Trends "A Review of the Academic Contributions of Academic Award Winners". Now I am very happy to see that she has actually won the award.

;

;There are traces of Goldin winning the Nobel Prize in Economics. She has served as president of the American Economic Association and the American Economic History Association, and has also been elected as a member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and the National Academy of Sciences. These important indicators of a scholar's academic status have long meant that Goldin has the potential to aspire to the top. The strength of the Bell Prize in Economics.

;

;;Uniqueness;

;

;The 2023 Nobel Prize in Economics not only continues the common rules of previous years, but also has its own unique features.

;

;First, the winner Golding is still from an American university. More than half of the scholars who won the Nobel Prize in Economics from 1969 to 2023 were from the United States, far ahead of the number of winners from other countries.

;

;Goldin was born in New York City in 1946. He received his bachelor's and doctoral degrees in economics from Cornell University and the University of Chicago. He has taught at the University of Wisconsin, Princeton University and the University of Pennsylvania. Now a professor of economics at Harvard University, she is the first female tenured professor in the history of Harvard University.

;

;Second, Goldin is the third female economist to win the Nobel Prize in Economics. When the Nobel Prize was first established, it did not include economics awards. Since the Nobel Prize in Economics was first awarded in 1969, male economists have always won this honor. Until 2009, Eleanor Ostrow Elinor Ostrom won the Nobel Prize in Economics for "innovative research in economic governance, especially in the governance of public resources." This is the first time a woman has won the prize.

;

;Ten years later, in 2019, Esther Duflo became the second female scholar to win the Nobel Prize in Economics. The reason for the award was for her outstanding contributions in the field of global poverty research. contribute.

;

;The third place is this year's Goldin. She revealed the main driving factors of gender differences in the labor market, which has far-reaching significance for understanding the female labor market.

;

;Interestingly, both Ostrom and Duflo shared the Nobel Prize in Economics with other scholars. For example, Duflo won the Nobel Prize in Economics at the same time with her husband, Abhijit Banerjee of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Professor Michael Kremer of Harvard University. Goldin’s husband, Lawrence F. Katz, is also an economics professor at Harvard University. The two have collaborated on many classic articles on labor economics and are a couple in the academic world. But it is a pity that Goldin and Katz were not able to share the Nobel Prize at the same time this time.

;

;Third, the research fields of the Nobel Prize in Economics are becoming more and more "down-to-earth". In the past, the Nobel Prize in Economics focused more on theoretical contributions. In recent years, the Nobel Prize in Economics has gradually begun to focus on the applied value of research. For example, Duflo, the second female economist to win the prize in 2019, studied poverty. Golding's systematic research on female employment and gender discrimination, the history of educational development and changes in wage structures also has important practical significance.

;

;;Goldin’s research characteristics;

;

;Goldin’s research not only focuses on the construction of a theoretical analysis framework, but also focuses on combining a large amount of economic history data to analyze Conduct research on real-life problems. Its research characteristics are to use a large amount of historical data combined with econometrics and other methods to conduct empirical research, and to analyze current problems through the perspective of the past in order to draw more practical conclusions.

;

;Here, we quote two cases from Goldin, one is a study on women’s working time legislation in the United States. In the 1940s, 40 states in the United States passed legislation on women's working hours, setting mandatory maximum working hours for each day of the week. Many scholars believe that these laws not only fail to effectively protect these groups, but even harm their own interests.

;

;But Golding used manufacturing data to conduct research and found that the maximum working hour legislation not only reduced the working hours of women, but also reduced the working hours of men, and the proportion of women in the manufacturing sector was also reduced. It has not been reduced due to restrictions in working hours laws. She also pointed out that the proportion of women in other industries such as sales has increased as working hours legislation has become more restrictive.  

;

;Another example shows the skill of Golding's approach to researching problems. Most studies generally use some traditional "discrimination coefficient" and other methods to measure female employment discrimination. However, Goldin cleverly directly measured female employment discrimination by comparing the recruitment methods of American symphony orchestras before and after the reform.

;

;Before the reform of recruitment methods, symphony orchestras mainly selected musicians through direct interviews among the many outstanding candidates selected by the music director. This method favored male applicants and favored female applicants. discrimination against persons.

;

;From the 1970s to the 1980s, the recruitment method was reformed in the form of "blind performance", that is, listening to the performance level through a curtain screen. In this way, the judges will not know the gender of the musician applicant and can only recruit based on the applicant's technical level.

;

;Since the implementation of this reform, Golding found that the "blind performance" format can increase the likelihood of women advancing from the preliminary round by 50%, and the likelihood of entering the final stage has also increased several times. , the possibility of becoming an orchestra musician also greatly increases.

;

;Employment discrimination problems may occasionally be encountered in real life, so some of Goldin's research may help solve these problems.

;

;;Main Economic Thoughts;

;

;Goldin has made important contributions to the study of gender discrimination, the history of educational development and the evolution of wage structure gaps.

;

;Female employment and gender discrimination are important research topics in the field of labor economics, which have attracted the attention of many economists. Goldin's research mainly focuses on occupational segmentation caused by gender differences, factors affecting female employment, and the measurement of gender discrimination.

;

;Systematic research on the theory of discrimination in the labor market began with G. Becker (1957). Later economists gave various explanations on the causes of discrimination and the influencing factors of discrimination. Such as the crowding hypothesis (Bergmann, 1971) and statistical discrimination (Phelps, 1972).

;

;Different from these theoretical explanations, Golding focuses on analyzing the influencing factors of gender discrimination in female employment from an empirical perspective. She believes that the gender discrimination faced by women in the job search process is the result of a combination of factors, and analyzes it from the perspectives of World War II, the availability of contraceptive pills, and legislation on maximum working hours.

;

;Scholars such as Golding believe that birth control pills reduce the likelihood of pregnancy and thus increase the age at which women get married for the first time. The widespread use of contraceptive pills among unmarried women has also reduced the cost of women's long-term career investment and increased the proportion of educated women. More female college graduates have entered the labor market, promoting women's employment.

;

;Workers can improve their labor productivity and thus their income by receiving education, but what is the relationship between years of education and income?

;

;In the article "The Quiet Revolution that Transformed Women's Employment, Education and the Family" (2006), Golding divided women's employment from the late 19th century to that time into four stages based on changes in women's educational attainment: In the first stage, from the late 19th century to the 1920s, women in the labor market were usually young, unmarried women. At this time, the income elasticity of labor supply was very high, while the substitution elasticity was very small. Most female workers were not well educated. . The second stage lasted from the 1930s to around 1950. In this stage, restrictions on married women's work were relaxed. The income elasticity of labor supply dropped significantly in absolute terms. Secondary school enrollment and graduation rates increased, and part-time work increased. The rise of the economy and the popularization of office facilities have greatly increased women's labor market participation rate. The third stage, from the 1950s to the 1970s, was the origin stage of the "Quiet Revolution". In the two age groups of 45-54 and 35-44, the labor force participation rate of women increased significantly, from 25% in 1950 rose to 46% in 1970. The fourth stage is from the late 1970s to the time when the paper was published, that is, the "quiet revolutionary stage." The Quiet Revolution is mainly manifested through three indicators: horizon, identity, and decision making. Horizon mainly refers to a woman’s ability to predict her future career more accurately; identity refers to a woman’s name after marriage. retaining their surname; decision-making allows her to be better prepared to enter the labor market. The conclusion is that changing trends in women's education have promoted women's employment.

;

;Economic inequality is closely related to the level of educational development. Goldin also gave a detailed explanation of the relationship between the two in his book "The Race between Education and Technology" (with L.F. Katz, 2008). She pointed out that the United States began to implement mass education at the beginning of the 20th century, making the 20th century known as the "human capital century" and the "American century."

;

;About education, technology and economic inequality, it can be summarized as follows: 1. A more educated labor force can produce higher labor productivity, which in turn produces rapid economic growth. However, it is important to note that economic growth does not depend solely on investment in education, but also on the type of government, the degree of protection of property rights, and many other prerequisites. 2.

;

;The development of education can also drive technological progress. In turn, the continuous progress of technology also requires more and better-educated labor force. Relative to the labor force with less education, the wages of labor force with more education are higher, and the insufficient supply of labor force with more education will inevitably lead to the labor force with more education and more education. The wage gap between the less educated workforce continues to grow. If the relative proportions of different levels of education remain unchanged, technological progress will inevitably bring about economic inequality; in other words, if the quantity and quality of education increase, technological progress will promote the decline of economic inequality. 3. Throughout the 20th century, the economic growth of the United States showed a continuous rise, but economic inequality showed discontinuity. In the first 70 years of the 20th century, economic growth brought about a decline in inequality, but in the last 20 years of the 20th century, economic inequality gradually increased. 4. Judging from the above statements, the main reason why inequality in the United States first declined and then increased in the 20th century was due to the out-of-synchrony between the speed of educational development and the demand for talents in the United States.

;

;In fact, there is a close connection between female employment and gender discrimination, educational development history and economic inequality. The development of education is an important factor influencing the increase in female employment and changes in economic inequality.

;

;Goldin has a wide range of research interests. In addition to the above-mentioned fields, it also involves many issues such as slavery and immigrant migration. She is a female economist with extensive research fields and rich academic achievements.

;

;(The author is a professor and doctoral supervisor at the Department of Economics, School of Economics, Liaoning University)
